brown.title: Brown University
brown.subtitle: Sc.B. in Mathematics—Computer Science
brown.desc: Relevant Coursework: Design and Analysis of Algorithms; Multiprocessor Synchronization; Cryptography; Cybersecurity and International Relations; Programming with Data Structures and Algorithms; Models of Computation; Fundamental Problems of Geometry; Combinatorial Topology; Abstract Algebra; and Linear Algebra

dalton.title: The Dalton School
dalton.desc:
• Member of ACSL Computer Science Team
  • National Merit semifinalist

reu.title: Research Experience for Undergraduates in Computational Mathematics
reu.subtitle: Researcher
reu.desc:
• Studied a novel 2-parameter family of kernel functions for data interpolation, under the direction of Greg Fasshauer, Ph.D, Professor of Applied Mathematics at the Illinois Institute of Technology
  • Contributed to a code repository of numerical experiments in Matlab
  • Conducted theoretical investigations of closed forms for Green’s functions associated with the 2-parameter family
  • Presented results at the Young Mathematicians Conference at Ohio State University; our abstract was one of 55 accepted out of 110 submitted
  • Presented results at the Joint Mathematics Meetings in San Diego, CA
  • Research funded by NSF grant DMS-1115392

penobscot.title: Penobscot Management, LLC
penobscot.subtitle: Real Estate Management Intern
penobscot.desc:
• Leased apartments and participated in management meetings in the Sales and Management office of a 6-building midrise property
  • Proposed an alteration to one of the buildings on the property that resulted in a $70,000 investment by the owner, with an additional $140,000 allocated for two additional buildings

splitr.title: splitr.co Coming soon
splitr.desc: Beginning development of a web app to divide things fairly among friends

paper.title: A 2-Parameter Family of Kernels for Data Interpolation Coming soon
paper.desc: Coauthoring a paper with my research partner from the REU program at IIT for submission to the Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics (SIAM) journal

resume.title: This Resume
resume.desc: As a way of getting familiar with the Node + CoffeeScript + Express + Jade + Less + Bootstrap stack, I built this resume page as an open-source Node app. The app renders resume content stored in a .JSON file. Serious overkill, I know, but hey… “learn by doing!” Check out the repo on github.

goclub.title: Brown University Go Club
goclub.subtitle: Founding Member
goclub.desc:
• Go is the ancient board game of strategy and tactics, believed to be the first board game ever invented, and as yet unconquered by computer programs
  • Helped found the Collegiate Go League, which to date has members from over 7 universities
  • Raised funds and recruited new members
  • Participated in Go tournament at M.I.T. in 2010, for the Brown University team
  • Received early support from the ING Foundation, whose mission is to promote the spread of Go in Western countries

winona.title: Winona Camps
winona.subtitle: Woodworking and Riflery Counselor
winona.desc:
• Held a leadership role among the staff as one of the senior counselors
  • Taught campers (ages 11–13) skills in woodworking (designing a project, drawing a plan, carpentry techniques) and techniques of marksmanship
  • Mentored campers, encouraging their independence and helping them develop self-confidence and social skills
  • Worked closely with other counselors as a team to ensure camp activities ran smoothly

piano.title: Piano Studies
piano.desc:
• Classical instruction from 2003–2009
  • Jazz instruction beginning in 2012
  • Performed recitals at Senior Living Centers as community service, 2008–2009

harmo.title: Harmonic Motion
harmo.subtitle: Beatboxer and bass singer
harmo.desc: “Brown & RISD's Hottest A Cappella Group.&#8221 Performances on campus throughout the academic year.
